Reviews.Title: “Best Value Hotel near Bastille”
Reviews.Author: FG97355
Reviews.Content: This is a very good value Hotel in Bastille area; there are special 2 or 3 day deals on week ends. The Manager and the staff are very welcoming; especially one receptionist could speak French, English, Spanish and Danish Fluently!!! The Size of the rooms are slightly larger than a typical Ibis and the bed are very comfortable. Furthermore, there is a nice Bar with good wines and Food (Especially the "Tricky" cheese baguette...).

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: Martyu
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and nice staff, The internet connection was slow

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend...great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Jana N
Reviews.Content: Overall great value hotel. I booked in advance and got a good deal for my 6 night stay. The room was small but you can't expect spacey hotel rooms in Paris unless you fork out your wallet. The room was very modern and the bed was extremely comfortable...just what you need after a full day of walking the streets of Paris! Breakfast too was fantastic! Definitely recommend to anyone travelling whether solo or as a couple but you hardly spend time in your hotel room anyway...your in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “un séjour agréable dans un cadre soigné et fonctionnel, une Direction attentive”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was ok. when I mentioned that my breakfast had been "lighter" than expected because I went downstairs at 9.45, reduced charge was immediately offered! Merci pour votre accueil et le calme de la chambre attribuée.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Neerajj
Reviews.Content: Good Points: A great location with plenty of pubs, restaurants and hangout places close by Metro at a walking distance Nice & helpful staff Ibis efficiency at its best Good internet speed Reliable taxi service A good and well-stocked supermarket nearby Bad Points: Very small rooms Even smaller toilet (like the one you get to see in the airplanes) Poor assortment of TV channels & no newspaper Will I stay here again?: Maybe, but would explore more options as I need more room space

Reviews.Title: “Another average + Ibis hotel”
Reviews.Author: kat1
Reviews.Content: Coming from Geneva, I always arrive at Gare de Lyon and as my budget accomodation, I tend to stay at one of the Ibis hotels in the area mroe and more, if my stay in only for 1 or 2 nights. For Ibis St Antoine you walk a few minutes more than Diderot or Ledru-Rollin but still fine. The rooms are like any Ibis one, no surprise, smaller room but with a big clean bed. I alway afind water pressure of the shower at IBIS hotels quite weak. This one is no exception but if you want otherwise, I suppose you need to pay more at a hotel of different categories. At St Antoine, the nice thing is the lady at the reception of African (north African ?) descent, quite smiling, nice and responsive. Another nice thing is they have a luggage room where they keep your luggage for free. Other Ibis I have stayed in Paris have coin operated lockers and cost minimum from 2/3 €. I also like the area of this hotel with lots of small shops, including bakeries, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: calsal Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reception very helpful. Hotel room well equiped and very clean. Nice area with cafes and restaurants within easy walking distance. Metro close by. Really enjoyed our stay.Ibis call centre said that we could not book a parking space for car.This was incorrect information.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel near Opera-Bastille”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights (weekend) at this hotel in October. I really enjoyed being close to the city centre, there are a few metro stations close to the hotel. A few restaurants and bars are within walking distance of the hotel and it is a safe area. I was very satisfied with cleanliness of the room. The room was smaller (but absolutely ok for Parisian standard).The staff was efficient and helpful - no complaints at all. I was very satisfied, a very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ibis St Antoine makes justice to the Ibis brand. The location is quite good close to metro and bus stations, however to visit downtown Paris prepare yourself to some line changes in both metro and bus, no direct line is there. In the beginning it was a little bit difficult to find since it is in an alley and not directly on the main street and there was some construction going on. Hotel in general and rooms are clean however the furniture is in dire need of renovation since the carpeted floors have significant stains on them. Staff in the reception could do more to address clients requests, usually they seemed bored even from the smallest inquiry especially when talked to in English. Manager is quite helpful and the supervision of the staff helped a lot in finding out solutions for our little problems. In general the rooms are extremely small but hey is Paris everybody you get the same size everywhere. I would have rated it more if the staff was more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Three day stopover in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We decided to have a short stopover in Paris on the way back to Sydney from Santorini. We visit Paris regularly and think this hotel is quite well situated wrt the metro and Bastille markets. The hotel is of normal Ibis standard - perfectly adequate for a short stay - although the decor of this hotel is dated compared to others. Breakfast was good, and dinner ok in an emergency. I needed to rest most of the time because of a health problem, and was dissappointed with the TV available - normally not a big issue. Plenty of French channels, an Italian and a German speaking - but no English. Given the number of English speaking tourists, I think this is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & very clean”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The price for our room was much lower than we spent on previous visits at other hotels. The room as basic, but very clean and with modern amenities. Just a short walk from metro stations. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, reasonably-sized room at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in one of the main tourist areas, so this might be a drawback for a first-time visitor, but you get a clean and much better room here at a better price than you are likely to find in one of those other areas. There are plenty of restaurants, cafes, shops, markets, parks, and patisseries in the immediate area, and it's less than a mile from the Bastille where there are a lot more restaurants, bars, other nightlife, etc. I thought the breakfast buffet was quite good at a reasonable price, although with all the bakeries and patisseries nearby, you could certainly get a cheaper breakfast that way, too. There is also a nice, quiet courtyard where you can enjoy a drink (bar drinks, coffee, some food items always available) or just chill out. The air-conditioning was also appreciated--temperatures were a little warmer than usual for my mid-September visit. The only relatively minor quibble I had during my stay was that the "king" bed I had appeared to actually be two sets of box springs and mattresses pushed together (one sheet covering) that tended to push apart at night. Other hotels I stayed at with the same bedding appeared to have a better way of ensuring these parts stayed together. Some may also be put off by the dispensers of one-size-fits-all liquid soap for bath/hand/shampoo, but I didn't find this much of an issue. Good, clean, reasonably-sized room that won't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “useful hotel to stay when in Bastille/Marais area”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I can recommend this hotel for people who expect from a hotel to serve properly its purpose without expecting any extravaganza. - clean space - good bed - no noise, so you can sleep with the windos open - nice breakfast - functional wifi connection in the room and throughout the lobby/restaurant area From my point of view its an ibis that holds its promises.

Reviews.Title: “Where everything else failed, Ibis was a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Dublin86
Reviews.Content: Our holiday started with a bad Ryanair flight, a charge of e40 for an 'oversized' bag and a hoard of rude cabin attendants. Not to mention Beavais Airport would put anyone in a bad mood. After the hour bus journey, 30 min train journey and 15 minute walk with a 4 year old we arrived at our hotel. The road leading to the hotel, Rue de St. Antoinne wasn't the most pleasant compared to some of the nice streets in Paris but it was fine. The Hotel was bigger than it looked in the photos. The first thing we noticed was how clean the place was and Staff were very friendly on check in. Our room was basic and small, but very clean. Ideal for a couple and 4 Year old. We had a front facing room to the road outside on the 2nd floor. It was actually quiet during the night and we weren't bothered by passing cars. Although noise of doors slamming in the hallway was a bit loud. Breakfast was good for the price. Location was pretty good if you don't have a kid with you. The closest Metro, Ledu-Rollin does not stop at any of the main attractions so Bastille is the stop to use. But with a 4 year old it takes 15-20 to get to. 10 mins for an adult on their own I would imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and cool location.”
Reviews.Author: logomanic Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a very pleasant stay in a neat and trendy part of Paris for good value. It is a little west of the Bastille and about a 30 minute walk to the city center, but near a metro station. There are lots of good eateries nearby too. The hotel room was small, but it was a very comfy bed, very clean and the staff were friendly. We didn't eat at the hotel because it looked pretty generic and there were too many good places nearby to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Bastille St. Antoine”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My American friends thought the rooms were quite small and basic compared to most US hotels, but compared to most hotels at this price in Paris, the rooms were absolutely fine. It's not charming or atmospheric like some other hotels, but it was very clean and comfortable, the staff were friendly and efficient, and the location was really convenient - lots of places to eat and drink, a supermarket, daily market, bus stop and Metro station only a couple of minutes away. A good, safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel: Clean, quiet, comfortable... but that's all”
Reviews.Author: SethG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis Bastille St Antoine in Paris for 4 nights in early July. Per my title, it was clean, quiet, and comfortable, plus the service was friendly and efficient enough, but not much more. Overall, given the cost, you can find a better value elsewhere. Location-wise, it's 2 blocks from the Ledru-Rollin Metro station but a fair distance, maybe 15 minutes walk I'd guess, from the Place de la Bastille. It should not be called Bastille, which fooled me. There are restaurants and bars in the surrounding area and also a supermarket. My room was small very basic: No hand towels, no soap or shampoo other than liquid all-purpose stuff in a squeeze bottle, no safe, no iron or ironing board. On the plus side: Very clean and the windows opened. WiFi was free but not high speed, but be warned that the breakfast is not free. For the amount I paid, Eur 119 weeknights plus Eur 8 breakfast, this was not a great bargain. I left feeling I'd paid maybe Eur 30 per night more than the room was worth, and that I should have stayed in a hotel that was nicer, had more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude staff ................ Not recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: Bubber8
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be very rude. When asked to check DeGaule Airport to see what terminal our flight would leave from, they said, flat out NO! we don't do that. They were not helpfull at all when asked directions.. The room was decent and it was accessable as requested. We did not eat here. We stayed at two Ibis hotels in Paris. The service could not be farther apart. The other was very good, this one was not good. I do not recommend this hotel and would NEVER return.

Reviews.Title: “sfas”
Reviews.Author: sfas Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We liked the location. It is close to the Opera and this is important for us. Metro is close by. Very good breakfast bar and very good cafe quality. The use of room card for the elevator was not always easy. Changing password every day for wifi is also negative. I consider that to much security makes life more difficult and it does not really improves security.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Quiet Hotel - Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: tonyy38
Reviews.Content: Only 800m from Gare de Lyon, this Hotel is in a quiet street near the Metro with plenty of small eateries nearby. Very pleasant staff were most helpful especially when ice was needed each for an injured knee. A bonus was the triple room which had a small extra room for our granddaughter. With a filling breakfast it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Ibis, had a good time mainly because of the location - definitely not the service”
Reviews.Author: uglybuttrue
Reviews.Content: The rooms were cleaner than expected and felt as though they had been refurbished rather recently. Location was pretty good with good transport links. However, when the air conditioner broke down (and began regurgitating stale air without any effect on the temperature) reception responded offhandedly, sending someone who merely tried the traditional 'switch off and back on' (which, unsurprisingly did not improve the situation), then upon the second call, the receptionist suggested drinking cold water. Free Wi-Fi has limits on usage and restrictions such as no streaming (which also seems to affect conference calls). It also requires the user to enter the given ID and password every time the internet browser is opened, which can get tiring. There were 2 computers in the lobby which presumably has better connections, but were constantly occupied. The parking was expensive, with additional charges (over and above the daily fee) applying per hour in the event of the car being removed from the car park (so costly for day trips with the car). The rooms were very economic in terms of space, and extremely basic - no kettles were provided. All that was provided in terms of toiletries was a one-for-all liquid soap of an apparently environmentally friendly sort that was suggested for use for the body, hands, AND hair. The area was quite quiet but the walls weren't soundproofed well at all, so noise levels depended heavily on the neighbours. Overall, extremely basic, and one should not have any expectations of friendly service. Definitely will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Just needs English language TV”
Reviews.Author: Geoff2ey Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Competent hotel in quiet area, recently refurbished, nice bathroom fittings, flat screen TV. TV was our main gripe - 30 channels including German, Italian and Portuguese, but no English language channel not even CNN. All non-European guests will have some English as a second language, so why not have a BBC or Sky or CNN news channel? Second smaller gripe was we looked at the breakfast and decided it was not good value so we went out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for 2 day paris Visit and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: mowbrab
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on a saturday evening and the receptionist was very helpful , taking the family up to the adjacent rooms and booking a carparking space in the Hotel basement. Remember to book carparking in advance ( I forgot ) , it is a very small carpark , but secure. Great location for a City Break , close to Metro . Very clean rooms and quiet location. Hotel breakfast is good value ( 8 Euros ) and served in a delightful room , with views over the Garden ( unusual for Paris City Hotels ).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to stay in Paris at low rate”
Reviews.Author: schuminou
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located close to Bastille, restaurants, cinema, ... Staff is OK, rooms are quite small but clean and comfortable. Breackfast is perfect. There is a car park but with only 10 places. If you know you will need one, book it before otherwise you will be obliged to find a place in this crowded area...

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: DDMHaddonfield_NJ
Reviews.Content: The room at the Ibis was small but clean. The service at the reception desk was very good. They responded promptly to all requests. The free internet was good and the hair dryer which you have to borrow from the desk was much better than what you usually get in a hotel at this price. The location was convenient to Gare de Lyon and not too far to walk to the Marais or Ile de la Cite. There were plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. I did not take the breakfast but did have a good espresso at the coffee bar in the lobby. As most hotels were booked during fashion week and the auto show, I was happy to get a room here and ended up being pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: LondonHelena
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using an online deal which got us a reduction, paying 69 euros a night. This hotel was not a romantic getaway, but it did everything I wanted. It was very clean, the room was a good size and, for people who are happy to do a little pavement tramping, I thought it was a good location. The neighbourhood was quiet but not at all dead. In general we were very pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “as per trip advisers”
Reviews.Author: bluedaisy22
Reviews.Content: very good selected on the basis of other trip adviser comments , small rooms but quiet and good value for paris;

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rooms. (ask for a room facing the inner yard). Good location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Evanstonians
Reviews.Content: I would summarize this hotel as ``good value''. The rooms are nice and clean (nothing special) and the staff was friendly. The breakfast in the morning is o.k. and it is nice you can have it in the hotel before going out for the whole day. One recommendation is to ask for a room that faces the inner yard. In the first night we stayed in a room facing the street and since we wanted to turn off the AC and open the windows that was a problem in terms of noise. In the second night, however, we moved to a room on the 5th floor and facing the inner yard. That was nice and quite. In terms of the location, there is a Metro station of line number 8 just a block a way but if you want to take a line that goes to the right bank of the river then you need to switch at the Bastille station (which was a problem when we were there because there were renovations in that station). Walking to the Bastille is also not that bad. For those that like walking, the hotel is a bit more than 20 minutes walk from the Notre Damn and less if you go to Il St. Louis.

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Tikibird
Reviews.Content: In Paris, it's all about location and this hotel is well located-walking distance to Le Marais and Bastille metro station. There is another metro-Ledru Rollin but only one line (8) goes there so we used Bastille most times. We got a good rate "Happy 30" for 59 Euros on the Ibis website which was an excellent deal for Paris. The room was small and basic but we really aren't fussy people. There are only a couple English channels-CNN, BBC but we found this to be the case even in 5 star hotels in Europe. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It was nice to be only a short walk from Canauxrama Seine River cruises as the night cruise gets back around 11pm. You can get a 4 Euro discount voucher in the tourist info rack in the lobby so no need to book ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jocelyne24
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal for this stay, which was because of a deal which meant that we had to split our stay into two bookings to take advantage of two different offers. The staff at the hotel were happy for us to do this and didnt make us change rooms. The location was great for getting around the city and was pretty quiet despite the very central location. The rooms were quite small (typical Ibis) but this was a good option for staying in Paris when the pound was very weak and the euro very strong. Reception staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheRudeDude
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are kinda small, but we knew that upfront and everything else was more then we hoped for. The rooms were nice and clean, it was quiet, the neighborhood is really great, close to Place de la Bastille and the staff is very friendly. Go for the early internet rates, and have breakfast in the neighborhood,.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Ibis hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mkle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this Ibis hotel together with our 3 month old son. We had a nice room on the 6th floor which was quite large for a typical Ibis hotel as we also asked for a bed for our baby. We found staff really friendly and helpfull and we would stay her again as the price is really OK compared to other parisien hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - Typcal Ibis hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon_Wigan
Reviews.Content: I was driving through Paris and needed a place to stay. I usually stay around the Bastille area since there are plenty of places to grab a beer and good choice of restaurants. My usual Ibis, Paris Bastille Opera, was full so stayed here. The hotel is typical of the Ibis hotels, average to small size room, basic, too much white pebbledash in the corridors but good value and clean. This hotel has a carpark with just 9 spaces that must be booked in advance. On this occasion it was full. The Bastille Opera has a much larger one where I have not had any problems parking. I managed to park on the street after a little circling and since it was a Sunday parking was free and overnight was free as per usual. Didn't have breakfast here since there are plenty of places nearby. Didn't eat here either. Pointless with a decent choice nearby. I would stay here again, if you definately need a secure carpark, use the Bastille Opera Ibis 5 mins away instead.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, small but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AM&AP
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly from the Ibis website, and saw that the parking had to be reserved directly with the hotel. But no e-mail address was given, so I had to call them directly. This was a slight annoyance - especially as the first time I called, the line was dropped (for other reasons I had to call the hotel other times, and on each first call, the line is dropped - I don't know why, but it's very annoying). The rooms were small, but I've never had a big hotel room in Paris. Clean, bright, and comfertable. The hotel has a nice little terrace where you can have breakfast (I didn't have the hotel breakfast - I knew a nicer cafe close by for half the price) or stop for a beer in the evening before going out for dinner. It's in a nice (ordinary life, ordinary people) area. 5 minute walk to the metro. 10 minute walk to Pl de la Bastille. All in all, I have no complaints. Except the price of the parking. At 14EUR per night, it's a little expensive. Maybe not expensive for Paris, but I got the feeling of being ripped off having to pay that much.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the night”
Reviews.Author: mom2074
Reviews.Content: We needed an overnight stay in Paris while en route to London. There was NO AVAILABILITY in the entire city of Paris. A friend was able to find this place for 99 euro. It is clean enough. Rooms are average size for Paris. Ledru-Rollin is the best metro stop to get off at. The 24h/24h lasagna was actually quite good. If you are needing a safe place to stay for a night this would be sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Gracie_Pug
Reviews.Content: This is a smashing little hotel in a great area that feels really safe. I've stayed here four times and have no complaints Ok, so the rooms are pretty miniscule. If you will be spending a lot of time in your room this may not be the best choice for you. There's no minibar, but there's a nice enough bar in the foyer area. However, you're in Paris so go try the local wine bars and brasseries. Be aware too that Breguet Sabin Metro (2 mins walk) is currently closed for refurb. But Richard Lenoir and Bastille stations are only 5 mins walk away so it's not a problem.

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Paris Bastille St Antoine
HotelInfo.Address: 13 Rue Trousseau | 11th Arr., 75011 Paris, France
